content.description: Start off in a bit of poor rock with hands. As you continue up, the crack pinches down and the rock scoops out past vertical. Once the crack disappears, clip a bolt and go for the anchors. This has great movement on good rock.
content.protection: Bring a couple hand-sizes with a few finger-sizes plus nuts.
content.location:
This is four routes to the right of

Mushroom Cloud

and is the obvious corner splitter starting with hands.

content.description: Climb the lower angle, pocketed face just right of the prominent, wide, corner crack.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It is two routes left of

Pick Pocket

.

content.description: This has an easy start with the crux coming after the second bolt when holds become small and crimpy at best. There is a fun hand switch for final bolt before a small run-out to the anchors.
content.protection: Climb past 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: It is on the far right on AEC in the shady alcove area.  This is the second route on the south-facing wall.

content.description: For most folks, the crux is off the ground with the wide hands crack. The rock is rough! Once past the wide bit, it becomes easier and has some cool movements following the crack under and to the right of the roof.
content.protection: #3 for the start. A couple hand-sizes and fingers for the rest.
content.location:
This is around the corner, to the right of

Finger Fusion

. It is the obvious, wide hands splitter.

content.description: The first half of the climb is the crux. It has good fingers and feet up the whole thing, and it has good rock. I wish it was longer!
content.location: This is the fifth climb from the left. It is just to the right of the OW corner, up the obvious finger splitter.

content.description: Start in a dihedral. When you kind of run out of holds, match hands on a slopey pinch on the arÃªte, and then move left to sandy crimps in the face. Stickclip a first high bolt.
content.location: It is the 7th route from the left.

content.description: Atomic Test Site is a fun V5+ on a rope in good rock.
content.location: In the far right area, it climbs a slightly overhanging wall.
